definition: to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
to dig/to excavate/to scoop out
wall/CL:面[mian4],堵[du3]
variant of 牆|墙[qiang2], wall
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: This backdoor run is forcing banks to sell assets and squeeze lending;
sentences.chinese: 这个挖墙脚的行为使银行出售资产并压缩贷款。

sentences.english: Everybody tries to mend the walls.
sentences.chinese: 人人都补墙，不会挖墙脚。

sentences.english: Nobody wants to damage the walls or split the house.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不想祸起萧墙，自挖墙脚。

definition: to rob sb of sth they cherish (idiom)
to poach (talent, personnel from competitors)/to raid (a competitor for its talent)/Taiwan pr. [wa1 jiao3]
to live off a rich man
to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
(theater) to dismantle the stage/(fig.) to pull the rug out from under sb's feet/to undermine sb's plans
see 腳踏兩隻船|脚踏两只船[jiao3 ta4 liang3 zhi1 chuan2]
lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
to squeeze in/to step in/to take part/to step between (two persons in a relationship)
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
lit. to kill the donkey when the grinding is done (idiom)/to get rid of sb once he has ceased to be useful
to dig one's own grave
to harbor evil intentions (idiom)
to retaliate
lit. don't let one's own fertile water flow into others' field/fig. keep the goodies within the family (proverb)
pinyin: fei2 shui3 bu4 liu2 wai4 ren2 tian2

definition: the quick-footed climb up first (idiom)/the early bird catches the worm/first come, first served
